page.title: 19Stansted's Castle.
page.content: To the east of the picturesque village of Stansted Mountfitchet stands the remains of a castle. It is believed that the site dates back to the Bronze Age,and many Bronze and Iron Age relics have been found. The Vikings and Saxons developed a setlement including a garrison castle to defend the Roman crossroads.By 1086 the settlement included 140 sheep,20 pigs and 8 slaves.The original castle was made of oak from the local forest.Over the years many examples of Roman pottery and cannonballs from Cromwellian times have been found. The site now is privately owned and construction is underway to develop a scaled working settlement which will be{the only one of its kind in the {world.}The end product will include animals,working crafts and a museum displaying valuable many finds.
